content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new composite structures have been successfully placed on the map. The intended research Lab at (0.5, 2.5)–designed to receive Automation Science Packs for technology research–was never established due to repeated placement and crafting failures. 
• Although the agent accessed pre‐existing processing facilities, these were not constructed during the current execution. An iron furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) was retrieved for refining iron ore into plates, and a copper furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0) was used for converting copper ore into plates. No additional entities now reside on the map.

ERROR TIPS
• get_entities Invocation Errors
  – Using unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. 'radius') resulted in a message that the function received an unexpected argument.
  – Passing multiple positional arguments when none are expected led to a “takes 0 positional arguments” error.
  • Tip: Verify and strictly adhere to the correct function signature for get_entities before invoking it.

• Lab Placement and Retrieval Issues
  – Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed because the lab was not present in the inventory.
  – Filtering for existing labs produced a “NoneType object is not iterable” error when no entities were returned.
  • Tip: Always confirm that the target item is available in the inventory and that the result from entity queries is valid before iterating over it.

• Lab Crafting Ingredient Shortages
  – Multiple crafting failures occurred due to missing intermediate components. Initial errors mentioned shortages related to iron‐gear‐wheels (and their dependence on iron plates), while subsequent errors indicated deficits in ingredients for electronic circuits (stemming from an inadequate supply of copper cables and copper plates). Later attempts again pointed to a shortage of iron-gear-wheels.
  • Tip: Before attempting to craft a Lab, ensure that all required sub-ingredients and their production pathways are fully satisfied. Verify resource availability and complete prerequisite processing so that intermediate components (such as iron-gear-wheels, copper cables, and electronic circuits) can be produced reliably.
